item.title: Monitoring des Programmes (partie opérationnelle) (Catégorie I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation Finale du P3AII et à mi-parcours P3AIII

L’action à évaluer :

  • P3A II numéro CRIS : ENPI/2010/022-856 (évaluation finale)
  • P3A III numéro CRIS: ENPI/2012 /024-299 et ENPI/2013/024-758 (évaluation à mi-parcours)
  • SPRING numéro CRIS: ENPI/2012/024-479 (évaluation à mi-parcours)

L'objectif général de ces programmes est de favoriser la réussite du partenariat engagé entre l’Union européenne et l'Algérie en soutenant les efforts de l’administration algérienne pour assurer la mise en œuvre de l’Accord d’association (AA) dans tous ses volets.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion. Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le programme P3A durant les deux phases II et III, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats « intermédiaires », en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à comprendre la performance de l’action, ses facteurs déterminants et ceux qui ont freiné l’obtention des résultats, de manière à modifier ses modalités de conception ou de mise en œuvre.

Monitoring des Programmes (partie opérationnelle) (Catégorie I)

  • Diplôme universitaire (Master degree); ou expérience équivalente de 18 ans, dans les secteurs relatifs au lot 7.
  • Ayant au moins 12 ans et préférablement 18 ans, d’expérience générale dans les secteurs relatifs au lot 7.
  • Expérience des enjeux et problématiques liées à l'harmonisation avec les standards internationaux/acquis de l’UE, plus particulièrement dans les domaines couverts par l'Accord d'association;
  • Expérience professionnelle dans le domaine du renforcement des capacités institutionnelles et dans le rapprochement législatif/réglementaire avec l’UE/les standards internationaux;
  • Parfaite maîtrise, orale et écrite, de la langue française.

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires :

  • Disposant d'une expérience de travail dans la région;
  • Connaissance du Manuel des jumelages institutionnels UE;
  • Participation à la mise en oeuvre d’un jumelage institutionnel ;
  • Connaissance du manuel des devis-programmes de l'UE;

Ayant une bonne connaissance des procédures et pratiques de l'UE, à titre d’exemple le cycle de programmation, la politique européenne de voisinage, les modalités d’aide et les instruments de financement, les engagements pris dans le cadre de la déclaration de Paris sur l’efficacité de l’aide, etc.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Monitoring des Programmes et Team leader (Catégorie I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation Finale du P3AII et à mi-parcours P3AIII

L’action à évaluer :

  • P3A II numéro CRIS : ENPI/2010/022-856 (évaluation finale)
  • P3A III numéro CRIS: ENPI/2012 /024-299 et ENPI/2013/024-758 (évaluation à mi-parcours)
  • SPRING numéro CRIS: ENPI/2012/024-479 (évaluation à mi-parcours) L'objectif général de ces programmes est de favoriser la réussite du partenariat engagé entre l’Union européenne et l'Algérie en soutenant les efforts de l’administration algérienne pour assurer la mise en œuvre de l’Accord d’association (AA) dans tous ses volets.

Les évaluateurs doivent fournir une explication des liens de cause à effet existant entre les intrants et les activités, et les extrants, les résultats et les impacts. Le travail des évaluateurs doit encourager la responsabilisation, la prise de décisions, l’apprentissage et la gestion. Cette évaluation est principalement vouée à fournir aux services compétents de l’Union Européenne, aux parties prenantes intéressées :

  • une analyse globale et indépendante de la performance qu’a eu le programme P3A durant les deux phases II et III, en prêtant une attention particulière à ses résultats « intermédiaires », en comparaison avec les objectifs fixés;
  • des leçons et des recommandations, de manière à améliorer, le cas échéant, les actions présentes et futures.

En particulier, cette évaluation servira à comprendre la performance de l’action, ses facteurs déterminants et ceux qui ont freiné l’obtention des résultats, de manière à modifier ses modalités de conception ou de mise en œuvre.

Monitoring des Programmes et Team leader (Catégorie I)

  • Diplôme universitaire (Master degree); ou expérience équivalente de 18 ans dans les secteurs relatifs au lot 7.
  • Ayant au moins 12 ans et préférablement 18 ans, d’expérience générale dans les secteurs relatifs au lot 7.
  • Avoir géré des équipes à savoir au moins 2 missions d'évaluation et/ou de monitoring ;
  • Expérience professionnelle dans le domaine du renforcement des capacités institutionnelles et dans les questions de rapprochement législatif/réglementaire avec l’UE;
  • Parfaite maîtrise, orale et écrite, de la langue française.

Expériences considérées comme des atouts supplémentaires :

  • Disposant d'une expérience de travail dans la région;
  • Connaissance du Manuel des jumelages institutionnels UE;
  • Participation à la mise en oeuvre d’un jumelage institutionnel ;
  • Connaissance du manuel des devis-programmes de l'UE; Ayant une bonne connaissance des procédures et pratiques de l'UE, à titre d’exemple le cycle de programmation, la politique européenne de voisinage, les modalités d’aide et les instruments de financement, les engagements pris dans le cadre de la déclaration de Paris sur l’efficacité de l’aide, etc.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

item.title: Expert on Information and Communication Technology
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to promote a more enabling environment for civil society development in Albania

To contribute to the creation of an enabling environment for civil society development in Albania by supporting civil society and government bodies in developing effective cooperation with CSOs based on common vision, shared values and mutual trust. With the following specific objectives:

  • To enhance capacities of civil society organizations, members of the National Council of Civil Society to engage in a systematic and continues dialogue with relevant governmental institutions and as well as other platforms of civil society, advising and influencing issues of strategic priority in the country.
  • To conduct a mid-term review of the implementation of the Roadmap on Enabling Environment for Civil Society in Albania, through a wide consultation process with civil society and relevant responsible institutions.
  • To provide technical support to Government efforts in fulfilling their commitments in improving the legal, financial and fiscal regulatory framework related to civil society sector as a key layer in ensuring appropriate fiscal and legal environment for operation of civil society.

Project duration: 300 days

Expert on Information and Communication Technology

Qualifications and skills Master’s Degree or equivalent in Information and Communication Technology (ICT).

General professional experience Minimum 3 years of experience in the area of analysis of ICT, development of MIS platforms and databases, interfaces with other systems.

Specific professional experience

  • Experience in designing official registers, databases or publicly accessible information systems within public administration or private sector.
  • Experience in developing electronic registers, MIS platforms, or other types of platforms related to registration, financing and other type of information related to civil society organization operations would be an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert on Legal framework
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to promote a more enabling environment for civil society development in Albania

To contribute to the creation of an enabling environment for civil society development in Albania by supporting civil society and government bodies in developing effective cooperation with CSOs based on common vision, shared values and mutual trust. With the following specific objectives:

  • To enhance capacities of civil society organizations, members of the National Council of Civil Society to engage in a systematic and continues dialogue with relevant governmental institutions and as well as other platforms of civil society, advising and influencing issues of strategic priority in the country.
  • To conduct a mid-term review of the implementation of the Roadmap on Enabling Environment for Civil Society in Albania, through a wide consultation process with civil society and relevant responsible institutions.
  • To provide technical support to Government efforts in fulfilling their commitments in improving the legal, financial and fiscal regulatory framework related to civil society sector as a key layer in ensuring appropriate fiscal and legal environment for operation of civil society.

Project duration: 300 days

Expert on Legal framework

Qualifications and skills Master’s Degree or equivalent, in Law.

General professional experience At least 3 years of experience in the area of legislation.

Specific professional experience

  • Professional experience and expertise in regard to development of legal framework analysis, establishing, technical recommendations in regard to legal environment for CSO’s operation in the context of EU Members States or EU candidate/potential candidate countries and/or transition economies.
  • Previous experience in supporting government capacities or civil society sector to develop specific measures/ legal frameworks/ analysis on the legal framework related to civil society in Albania would be an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to promote a more enabling environment for civil society development in Albania

To contribute to the creation of an enabling environment for civil society development in Albania by supporting civil society and government bodies in developing effective cooperation with CSOs based on common vision, shared values and mutual trust. With the following specific objectives:

  • To enhance capacities of civil society organizations, members of the National Council of Civil Society to engage in a systematic and continues dialogue with relevant governmental institutions and as well as other platforms of civil society, advising and influencing issues of strategic priority in the country.
  • To conduct a mid-term review of the implementation of the Roadmap on Enabling Environment for Civil Society in Albania, through a wide consultation process with civil society and relevant responsible institutions.
  • To provide technical support to Government efforts in fulfilling their commitments in improving the legal, financial and fiscal regulatory framework related to civil society sector as a key layer in ensuring appropriate fiscal and legal environment for operation of civil society.

Project duration: 300 days

Expert on Financial and Fiscal framework

Qualifications and skills

  • Master’s Degree or equivalent, in public finance, fiscal policies or economic sciences.
  • Excellent written and oral working knowledge of English

General professional experience

At least 12 years of experience in the area of public finance management, business or public administration or fiscal policies.

Specific professional experience

  • At least of 3 years of professional experience in relation to fiscal and financial CSO framework policy analysis, development of technical recommendations in regard to favouring financial and fiscal environment for CSO’s operation.
  • Previous professional experience specifically focused in supporting government capacities to develop specific measures/ legal frameworks/ analysis on the fiscal and financial framework related to civil society would be an advantage.

item.title: Expert on Capacity Building
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to promote a more enabling environment for civil society development in Albania

To contribute to the creation of an enabling environment for civil society development in Albania by supporting civil society and government bodies in developing effective cooperation with CSOs based on common vision, shared values and mutual trust. With the following specific objectives:

  • To enhance capacities of civil society organizations, members of the National Council of Civil Society to engage in a systematic and continues dialogue with relevant governmental institutions and as well as other platforms of civil society, advising and influencing issues of strategic priority in the country.
  • To conduct a mid-term review of the implementation of the Roadmap on Enabling Environment for Civil Society in Albania, through a wide consultation process with civil society and relevant responsible institutions.
  • To provide technical support to Government efforts in fulfilling their commitments in improving the legal, financial and fiscal regulatory framework related to civil society sector as a key layer in ensuring appropriate fiscal and legal environment for operation of civil society.

Project duration: 300 days

Expert on Capacity Building

Qualifications and skills

Master degree or equivalent in social, economic or political sciences, public administration, international relations or international development.

General professional experience

At least 12 years of professional experience in the area of civil society.

Specific professional experience

  • At least 3 years of experience in projects/ programmes focused on capacity building of civil society specifically in one of the areas of, communication and advocacy, policy dialogue, strategic planning or lobbying and influencing, EU accession process and legislative changes at local and national level.
  • Experience on at least 1 (one) EU funded project focused on defining and implementing capacity building programmes for civil society, either in EU Member States and/or potential candidate/candidate countries for EU membership.
  • Previous experience in supporting government capacities to develop cooperation with civil society would be an advantage

item.title: Team Leader and Expert on Strategic Development
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to promote a more enabling environment for civil society development in Albania

To contribute to the creation of an enabling environment for civil society development in Albania by supporting civil society and government bodies in developing effective cooperation with CSOs based on common vision, shared values and mutual trust. With the following specific objectives:

  • To enhance capacities of civil society organizations, members of the National Council of Civil Society to engage in a systematic and continues dialogue with relevant governmental institutions and as well as other platforms of civil society, advising and influencing issues of strategic priority in the country.
  • To conduct a mid-term review of the implementation of the Roadmap on Enabling Environment for Civil Society in Albania, through a wide consultation process with civil society and relevant responsible institutions.
  • To provide technical support to Government efforts in fulfilling their commitments in improving the legal, financial and fiscal regulatory framework related to civil society sector as a key layer in ensuring appropriate fiscal and legal environment for operation of civil society.

Project duration: 300 days

Team Leader and Expert on Strategic Development

Qualifications and skills

Master degree or equivalent in social, economic or political sciences, international development, international relations, public administration or law.

*General professional experience *

At least 12 years of professional experience in the area of civil society development of which at least 3 years of experience in the area of strategic development of civil society; a) developing roadmaps, plans or strategies for an enabling policy, financial and legal environment for civil society or b) policy dialogue and reforms processes between non state/civil society actors and state actors in the context of EU accession, either in the context of Members States or EU candidate/potential candidate countries and/or transition economies.

Specific professional experience

  • At least 3 years of experience in team leadership, acting as a Team leader related to managing projects focused on civil society development, enabling legal and policy environment, development of strategies or roadmaps for civil society development, policy dialogue and cooperation between civil society and public institutions for reform processes.
  • Experience on at least 1 EU funded project related to development of policy analysis, strategic planning or a sectoral policy reform, which has demonstrated a strong and strategic engagement of civil society throughout the process will be an advantage.
  • Experience with similar type of assignments in pre-accession and/ or Western Balkan countries will be an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Expert on Internal Market of Albania
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation of Private Sector Development/ Competitiveness Sector, including intervention in the agribusiness sector in Albania

Conducting a sector-level evaluation based on a limited number of IPA projects in the field of PSD/C in Albania. The projects are mainly technical assistance projects which have been finalised or are currently under implementation, covering the period of IPA 2007-2013 and IPA II (projects started in 2009 to ongoing).

Project duration: 180 days

Expert on Internal Market of Albania

Qualifications and skills

  • Master degree or equivalent in relevant field.
  • Excellent oral and written skills in English.

General professional experience

  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in the areas related to Internal Market, Competition, and Intellectual Property Rights.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

item.title: Key Expert 2: Civil Society and Research Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Enhancing Civil Society Organisations and Local Authorities contributions to governance and development Processes

The purpose of this contract is to contribute to and prepare EU action in Sierra Leone that targets two objectives:

  • CSOs are strengthened as actors in governance and accountability, as partners in promoting social development, and as stakeholders in promoting inclusive and sustainable growth
  • Local authorities are empowered to achieve more effective development objectives while responding to citizens' demands and to promote inclusive and sustainable local development

Key Expert 2: Civil Society and Research Expert

Education:

  • A bachelor’s degree in political science/law/economics, development studies or a related degree

General professional experience:

  • At least six years of working experience in the field of designing, implementing or evaluating development support programmes with a strong element of interrelation with or support to the civil society, preferably in West Africa.
  • Substantial knowledge and first-hand experience of working in development in Sierra Leone is a requirement.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least five years of working experience with civil society organisations, including donor funded projects involving civil society actors
  • Experience of at least three assignments carrying out socio-economic research and mapping in developing countries
  • Proven experience in data collection, including different methods such as semi-structured interviews, focus group discussions, analysis and report writing as well as statistical analysis.
  • Experience with EU funded projects will be an advantage
  • Experience of preparing CSO mapping studies

Language Skills:

  • Fluency in English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Key Expert 1: Civil Society and Local Governance Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Enhancing Civil Society Organisations and Local Authorities contributions to governance and development Processes

The purpose of this contract is to contribute to and prepare EU action in Sierra Leone that targets two objectives:

  • CSOs are strengthened as actors in governance and accountability, as partners in promoting social development, and as stakeholders in promoting inclusive and sustainable growth
  • Local authorities are empowered to achieve more effective development objectives while responding to citizens' demands and to promote inclusive and sustainable local development

Key Expert 1: Civil Society and Local Governance Expert

Education:

Master degree in political science/law/governance/public policy/development studies or equivalent.

General professional experience:

At least ten years of working experience in planning, implementing and evaluating development support programmes.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least eight years of working experience in support of inclusive local development and service delivery (e.g. water and sanitation, health, infrastructure, education or energy) in
  • developing countries, including planning, implementing and evaluating of programmes.
  • Experience as team leader on at least three assignments
  • Proven experience in preparing socio-economic assessment studies and analyses, including study design, research and collection of quantitative and qualitative data (minimum of two)
  • Proven experience of designing and implementing large programmes specifically in support of civil society and local authorities, including preparation of terms of references
  • Experience with EU cooperation modalities (budget lines and EDF) will be regarded as an asset

Language Skills:

  • Fluency in English
  • Excellent report writing, communication and facilitation skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

item.title: Senior Expert in Economics, Social Sciences, Development and Cooperation, with Specialisation in Environmental and Diversity Institutions and Funds (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to the TAAF for the programming of the 11th EDF OCT Regional Programme

L'expert a pour mission d'assister l'Administration des TAAF a l’elaboration du projet de document de Programmation, ainsi que du projet de convention de financement, pour le programme regional ≪PTOM-Ocean Indien≫ au titre du Heme FED-PTOM, en conformiteavec les dispositions de la Decision d’association outre-mer. Prestations demandées:

  • Définition et formulation du document d'action
  • Adaptations nécessaires des projets de documents
  • Finalisation du projet de document de programmation
  • Préparation du projet de convention de financement

Senior Expert in Economics, Social Sciences, Development and Cooperation, with specialization in environmental and diversity institutions and funds (Category I).

Expert supérieur en économie, sciences sociales, développement et coopération, avec une spécialisation dans les institutions et fonds européens et l’environnement et la biodiversité (Catégorie I). Exigences:

Éducation: Diplôme universitaire en sciences de l’environnement, développement local ou développement durable

Expérience:

  • 12 ans minimum dans la conduite et l’ingénierie de projet
  • 10 ans minimum dans l’élaboration et le suivi de politiques environnementales
  • 6 ans minimum dans la gestion administrative des instruments, programmes et projets européens (tels que LIFE, FED, FEDER etc.)
  • 6 ans minimum dans le développement territorial et de la gestion des espaces naturels
  • 3 ans minimum dans l’élaboration de diagnostics territoriaux et de plans d’action
  • Expérience dans l’évaluation de projets territoriaux
  • Connaissance fine des enjeux de développement et du contexte diplomatique de la zone sud-ouest océan Indien

Langues:

  • Parfaite maîtrise, orale et écrite, de la langue française
  • Très bonne maîtrise de la langue anglaise

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to gabriela_georgieva@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Un (e) Expert(e) Chef de Mission en Institutionnalisation du Genre et Diagnostic (Cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mission d'appui au Ministere de la Femme, la Famille et l Enfance, au conseil des pairs et ses partenaires

Objectifs généraux Evaluer et renforcer les capacités du Ministère de la Femme, de la Famille et de l’Enfance et de ses partenaires en intégration de l’approche genre.

Objectif(s) particulier(s) Les objectifs particuliers sont :

  • Réaliser le diagnostic organisationnel et fonctionnel de la direction générale des affaires de la femme et la famille a l’échelle nationale et régionale
  • Appuyer les membres du conseil des pairs (décret 2016/626 - du 25 mai 2016) sur la thématique ≪ Genre ≫
  • Appuyer les cadres de la direction générale des affaires de la femme et la famille au niveau national et régional par des formations générales et spécifiques.
  • Former les chefs du programme du MFFE et des autres partenaires étatiques sur la thématique ≪ Budgétisation sensible au genre≫.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert on Social Cash Transfers (cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
‘Evaluate the Community Score Card methodology and success in 24 communities in Swaziland, to empower grassroot citizen to demand quality basic service’

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Expert on Social Cash Transfers (cat II)

  • at least 6 years’ experience in a social sector, with some of it related to poverty reduction and/or social transfers
  • a basic degree in a social sector and a Master Degree in a relevant sector, such as social protection, Social Science, economics, poverty related studies, social work, or related relevant studies. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 8 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • proven experience with poverty reduction programmes, and/or social transfer programmes, social welfare problematics, and/or targeting mechanisms for vulnerable groups, benefit delivery mechanisms, monitoring and database maintenance for social programmes,…
  • knowledgeable about conditionalities in welfare programmes, co-responsibilities of beneficiaries, and how to monitor these.
  • proven experience with social cash transfer schemes in developing countries would be an advantage
  • proven experience in working with orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) in developing countries would be an advantage
  • experience in monitoring and/or evaluation of development projects, preferable in a developing country setting, would be an advantage
  • experience with EU methodology and regulations, EU monitoring and reporting practices would be an advantage.
  • computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Specialist in linking communities to Primary Health Care (cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluate the Community Score Card methodology and success in 24 communities in Swaziland, to empower grassroot citizen to demand quality basic service

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Specialist in linking communities to Primary Health Care (cat II)

  • At least 6 years’ experience in the health sector, preferable in basic health services, preferably in developing countries
  • At least a basic degree in the health sector and a Master Degree in a relevant sector. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 8 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • Experience with health systems in an African setting. Knowledgeable in Primary Health Care strengthening in a development setting (for example: the health pyramid, referral systems, basic health care packages, essential drugs management, hygiene and infection control in health facilities, retention of health care workers, quality of PHC).
  • Knowledgeable, through experience, of barriers to access to basic services, for disadvantaged communities, due to poverty, distance, cultural obstacles, etc.
  • Proven experience in monitoring and/or evaluation of health projects, preferable in a developing country setting.
  • Having knowledge of EU regulations and procedures in external development actions would be an advantage.
  • Computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • Good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Community mobilisation specialist; project evaluation specialist (team leader; cat I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluate the Community Score Card methodology and success in 24 communities in Swaziland, to empower grassroot citizen to demand quality basic service

The global objective of the assignment is:

  • to assess the relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, impact and sustainability of the project “Interact with Communities and Health Facilities to implement Community Score Card” implemented by World Vision-Swaziland, with technical assistance and capacity development specifically on the CSC methodology, delivered by COSPE-Italy;
  • to verify that the activities and results of the project are in line with those outlined in the Financing Agreement, and project documents annexed to the respective contracts.

Community mobilisation specialist; project evaluation specialist (team leader; cat I)

  • At least 12 years' experience in the community mobilization and/or grass-root empowerment and/or participatory governance. The expert must have experience in project evaluation, preferably in developing countries.
  • At least a basic degree in the social sector, or governance and development or economics and a Master Degree in a relevant sector. In absence of required diploma, equivalent professional experience with duration above 14 years must be demonstrated in the CV.
  • Proven experience in monitoring and evaluation of development projects, preferably in developing countries
  • Experience with community mobilization, or participatory approaches, or grass-root empowerment, or linking rural populations with governance and service monitoring, preferably in developing countries.
  • Experience with community engagement techniques, such as Focus Group Discussions, Key Informant Interviews, and/or working with Local Authorities in rural settings.
  • Experience with Project Cycle Management: from implementation to M&E; the use of Logical Frameworks, the interpretation of indicators to follow progress, the methodology of output/outcome/impact monitoring
  • Experience with EU procedures in external actions (PRAG, finance and contracts issues, project cycle, monitoring EU projects preferably having knowledge the EU Results Oriented Monitoring methodology - ROM).
  • Computer literacy; excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and reporting skills
  • Good teamwork ability and culturally sensitive
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: SME Development Specialist (Cat III)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Final Evaluation of IPA 2011 Grant Support for Local Economic Development

Global objective: To provide the Delegation of the European Union with systematic and timely evaluation of its programme to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

Specific objective: The specific objective of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform of future choices on IPA II support to Bosnia and Herzegovina in the field of SME competitiveness and innovation at local level.

SME Development Specialist (Cat III)

Qualifications and skills

  • Education at least Master Degree in any field related to economic sciences, or in its absence, at least 3 years of relevant experience in the private sector development are required above the general professional experience required below.

General professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in the private sector development.

Specific professional experience:

  • As a minimum, this expert must have participated in one international aid project in the area of SME or local economy development completed in the past five years.
  • The expert should preferably demonstrate previous relevant expertise in the country/region.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of English, both spoken and written.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to lina_forgeaux@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

Final Evaluation of IPA 2011 Grant Support for Local Economic Development

Global objective: To provide the Delegation of the European Union with systematic and timely evaluation of its programme to demonstrate accountability and to promote lesson learning to improve policy and practice.

Specific objective: The specific objective of the evaluation is to identify key lessons and to produce recommendations to improve current and inform of future choices on IPA II support to Bosnia and Herzegovina in the field of SME competitiveness and innovation at local level.

Evaluation Expert (Cat II)

Qualifications and skills

  • Education at least Masters Degree Academic level, or in its absence, at least 6 years of relevant experience in the private sector development are required above the general professional experience required below.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of relevant experience in EU SME policy, preferably gained in implementation of the EU funded projects.
  • The expert should preferably demonstrate previous relevant expertise in the country/region.

item.title: Expert in IT Security
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation of supply tender dossiers for Serbian Ministry of Interior (MUP)

Global objective

The overall objective of this assignment is to support Serbia’s commitment in meeting EU standards in the field of safety and security through implementation of Action Plan on Chapter 24 and Chapter 23.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives of this assignments is to provide preliminary assessments, market researches, preparation of technical specifications and tender dossiers and providing input during clarifications and in the tender evaluations for the following tender procedures:

  • Supply of ICT equipment, security equipment, software solutions and analytical tools for strengthening capacities within Home Affairs Sector for the fight against organized crime by implementation of: Intelligence Led Policing, National Criminal Intelligence System and Strengthening international police cooperation (in line with EUROPOL standards)
  • Supply of video, audio and IT equipment for strengthening capacity of Internal Control Unit to fight against corruption within the police

Expert 3 Expert in IT security - Category 2

Qualifications and skills:

  • University degree /Master Degree (where a university degree has been awarded on completion of four years study or equivalent institutions) in the field of engineering, information and technology or other field related to this contract
  • Fluency in English, both written and spoken

General professional experience:

  • At least 6 (six) years of working experience in the design and management of security and integration of ICT infrastructure.

Specific professional experience:

  • Minimum 3 years, preferably 5 years of experience in the area of Information System Security (as cryptography - symmetric and asymmetric, cryptographic technology and RFID technology); using of smart cards in design application and access control solutions, access control system implementation with business continuity aspects.
  • Experience in preparation of technical specifications and /or Terms of References for 1, preferably 2, IT projects.
  • Experience in at least 1 project in design/implementation of communications and security systems for law enforcement bodies ( police /prosecutor) is an asset

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to aurelie_durand@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
